title: NASA “Pauses” Mars Sample Return Program While Assessing Options
summary: NASA officials told an advisory committee today they are pausing the Mars Sample Return program as they assess alternative architectures in the wake of increased costs and constrained budgets. A […]

title: Air Force warns programs will come to ‘screeching halt’ without budget deal
summary: Secretary of the Air Force Frank Kendall issued a stark warning Nov. 13 about the impact of funding delays and continuing threats of government shutdowns.

title: NASA slows down work on Mars Sample Return due to budget uncertainty
summary: NASA is slowing down work on Mars Sample Return (MSR) amid uncertainty about its budget for next year and an ongoing review of alternative architectures for the program.

title: SpaceX founding employee successfully moves from rockets to in-space propulsion
summary: "We want to make it cheap and easy to get anywhere in the Solar System."

title: First Dream Chaser Vehicle Ready for Final Testing
summary: After years of work, Sierra Space’s first Dream Chaser reusable spaceplane is almost ready to fly. The vehicle’s next step is a trip to NASA’s Neil A. Armstrong Test Facility in Ohio ahead of its first launch at the Kennedy Space Center currently scheduled for no earlier than March 2024.
